items.title: From the archives: Naturalist Jane Goodall
items.standfirst: Famed naturalist Jane Goodall, who dedicated her life to studying chimpanzees and protecting the environment, died on Wednesday, Oct. 1, 2025 at age 91. In this Oct. 24, 2021 "Sunday Morning" profile, she talked with Seth Doane about her fascination with animals, her groundbreaking work with primates, and her advocacy for a more sustainable future.
items.content: Famed naturalist Jane Goodall, who dedicated her life to studying chimpanzees and protecting the environment, died on Wednesday, Oct. 1, 2025 at age 91. In this Oct. 24, 2021 "Sunday Morning" profile, she talked with Seth Doane about her fascination with animals, her groundbreaking work with primates, and her advocacy for a more sustainable future.

items.title: Jane Goodall, pioneering primatologist, conservationist and activist, dies at 91
items.standfirst: Jane Goodall, the pioneering primatologist, conservationist and activist who became the world‚Äôs leading expert on chimpanzees, died on Wednesday at the age of 91, the Jane Goodall Institute said in a social media post. Born in London on April 3, 1934, Goodall produced a groundbreaking field study on chimpanzees in the wild in the 1960s and dedicated the latter part of her life to protecting their habitats.
items.content: Jane Goodall, the pioneering primatologist, conservationist and activist who became the world‚Äôs leading expert on chimpanzees, died on Wednesday at the age of 91, the Jane Goodall Institute said in a social media post. Born in London on April 3, 1934, Goodall produced a groundbreaking field study on chimpanzees in the wild in the 1960s and dedicated the latter part of her life to protecting their habitats.

items.title: Thousands of workers protest in Greece over 13-hour work day plans
items.standfirst: Thousands of Greek workers prompted large-scale disruption during a 24-hour general strike on Wednesday, protesting against the conservative government's plans to introduce a 13-hour work day. The strike has disrupted transport in the capital Athens and the second-largest city Thessaloniki, trains and ferry services, while teachers, hospital staff and civil servants are also taking part.
items.content: Thousands of Greek workers prompted large-scale disruption during a 24-hour general strike on Wednesday, protesting against the conservative government's plans to introduce a 13-hour work day. The strike has disrupted transport in the capital Athens and the second-largest city Thessaloniki, trains and ferry services, while teachers, hospital staff and civil servants are also taking part.

ai_summary: A general strike paralyzed Greece due to new labor laws.

clusters.title: Gaza aid flotilla presses journey, accuses Israel of 'intimidation'

items.title: Gaza aid flotilla presses journey, accuses Israel of 'intimidation'
items.standfirst: A flotilla bound for Gaza with aid for the war-battered Palestinian territory said on Wednesday that it would continue its course despite what it called "intimidation tactics" by the Israeli military. The flotilla of some 45 vessels carrying activists and politicians, including Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg and Nelson Mandela's grandson Mandla Mandela, departed Spain last month with the aim of breaking the blockade on Gaza, where the UN has said there is a famine.
items.content: A flotilla bound for Gaza with aid for the war-battered Palestinian territory said on Wednesday that it would continue its course despite what it called "intimidation tactics" by the Israeli military. The flotilla of some 45 vessels carrying activists and politicians, including Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg and Nelson Mandela's grandson Mandla Mandela, departed Spain last month with the aim of breaking the blockade on Gaza, where the UN has said there is a famine.

items.title: Pro-Palestine flotilla heading towards Gaza ‚Äòharassed by Israeli naval boats‚Äô
items.standfirst: Account of ‚Äòintimidatory operation‚Äô comes as Italy and Greece repeat call for Israel to guarantee safety of flotillaA pro-Palestinian flotilla heading to Gaza has said it has been approached and harassed by Israeli naval boats that jammed one of its lead vessels‚Äô communication systems as Italy and Greece reiterated calls for Israel to guarantee the safety of those onboard.The Global Sumud Flotilla (GSF), carrying about 500 people including the climate campaigner Greta Thunberg and former Barcelona mayor Ada Colau, said it had an encounter with Israeli navy vessels that circled the fleet‚Äôs ‚Äúlead boat for around six minutes‚Äù while remotely disabling its communication systems. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Italy to end support for international Gaza flotilla as it nears destination

Continue reading...
items.content: The Global Sumud Flotilla, with over 500 people including Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, aims to break Israel‚Äôs blockade of GazaItaly has said it will stop tracking an international flotilla attempting to deliver aid to Gaza with a military vessel, as activists on board announced they were on ‚Äúhigh alert‚Äù as they moved closed to their destination.The Global Sumud Flotilla, consisting of more than 40 civilian boats with over 500 people including parliamentarians, lawyers and Swedish climate campaigner Greta Thunberg, aims to break Israel‚Äôs blockade of Gaza.
